sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition method:
   
    x + 2y - 3z = 5
    3x + 4y - 5z = 7
    2x + 3y - 2z = 1

Provide the final values of x, y, and z.
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the QR decomposition method, we first need to represent the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 1  2 -3 |
    | 3  4 -5 |
    | 2  3 -2 |

b = | 5 |
    | 7 |
    | 1 |

Now, we need to find the QR decomposition of A, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthonormal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = | 1 |
     | 3 |
     | 2 |

e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = | 1/√14 |
                   | 3/√14 |
                   | 2/√14 |

u2 = | 2 |
     | 4 |
     | 3 | - ((1, 3, 2) • (2, 4, 3)) / ||(1, 3, 2)||^2 * (1, 3, 2)
       = | 2 |
         | 4 |
         | 3 | - (20/14) * (1, 3, 2)
       = | 6/7  |
         | 8/7  |
         | 10/7 |

e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = | 6/√126 |
                   | 8/√126 |
                   | 10/√126 |

u3 = | -3 |
     | -5 |
     | -2 | - ((1, 3, 2) • (-3, -5, -2)) / ||(1, 3, 2)||^2 * (1, 3, 2) - ((6/7, 8/7, 10/7) • (-3, -5, -2)) / ||(6/7, 8/7, 10/7)||^2 * (6/7, 8/7, 10/7)
       = | -3 |
         | -5 |
         | -2 | - (11/14) * (1, 3, 2) - (28/18) * (6/7, 8/7, 10/7)
       = | -1/3 |
         | -1/3 |
         |  2/3 |

e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = | -1/√6 |
                   | -1/√6 |
                   |  2/√6 |

Now we have the orthonormal basis, so we can form the orthogonal matrix Q:

Q = | 1/√14  6/√126 -1/√6 |
    | 3/√14  8/√126 -1/√6 |
    | 2/√14 10/√126  2/√6 |

Next, we need to find the upper triangular matrix R:

R = Q^T * A

R = | 14/√14  20/√14  -11/√14 |
    |   0    126/√126 -28/√126 |
    |   0      0       6/√6    |

Now, we have the QR decomposition of A:

A = QR

We can now solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = | (1/√14, 3/√14, 2/√14) • (5, 7, 1) |
          | (6/√126, 8/√126, 10/√126) • (5, 7, 1) |
          | (-1/√6, -1/√6, 2/√6) • (5, 7, 1) |

Q^T * b = | 14/√14 |
          | 28/√126 |
          |  6/√6    |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b using back-substitution:

z = (6/√6) / (6/√6) = 1

y = (28/√126 - (-28/√126) * z) / (126/√126) = 1

x = (14/√14 - (20/√14) * y - (-11/√14) * z) / (14/√14) = 1

So, the final values of x, y, and z are:

x = 1
y = 1
z = 1
